ygData.subject: Re: Levitation
ygData.msgSnippet: If you are the one to cast levitate(the spell) or any other beneficial spell on yourself, you can cancel it at any time by left clicking on the icon. You
ygData.messageBody:
If you are the one to cast levitate(the spell) or any other beneficial
spell on yourself, you can cancel it at any time by left clicking on the
icon. You cannot rid bad effects or any effects that someone else places on
you. Same holds true for our songs when special circumstances arise.

Good Journey,

Sineras Silverlyre (Cazic-Thule)


8)-----Original Message-----
8)From: Lost Child [mailto:lostchild@...]
8)Sent: Monday, June 28, 1999 2:57 PM
8)To: eqbards@onelist.com
8)Subject: Re: [eqbards] Levitation
8)
8)
8)From: Lost Child <lostchild@...>
8)
8)Don't use the levitation song within a dungeon. There is a
8)bug, or Verant
8)calls it FEATURE, that let MOBS hit you from anywhere while you are
8)levitating. Actually for us is better since we can stop the
8)song and land
8)anytime we want. But for the other classes, they have to
8)wait until the
8)spell wears out. Druid friends also told me not to use it
8)over water, since
8)shark can hit you from anywhere and there is no way to fight
8)back when you
8)are above water. I guess it is only for the spell not the
8)song, we could
8)always drop down into water anytime we want.
8)
8)>
8)>Well, I finally got out of the first level of hell, and was
8)able to try the
8)>song I had prebought two weeks prior to hitting 31,
8)Agilmente's Aria of
8)>Eagles. Boy was it nice. Not only did it levitate me, but
8)when it pulses
8)>it actually raises you up a bit, so when it pulses during
8)the highest point
8)>of the wavey motion, it actually lifts you higher. I took it through
8)>Dagnor's Cauldron, soaring past the aqua goblin camp, and
8)paying no heed to
8)>the steep cliffs. I entered Unrest and floated around in
8)the outside a
8)>bit.
8)>I perched atop the small island to the right next to the gazebo, and
8)>attempted to fly over to the door's canopy. I didn't quite
8)make it, and no
8)>sooner was I simultaneously attacked by a Greater Dark Bone,
8)a Tentacle
8)>Terror, and a Dark Terror from the depths of the basement.
8)These were no
8)>where to be seen, but my text box was spammed with red. My
8)health quickly
8)>dropped, and despite my efforts to flee, my pursuers were
8)always right on
8)>my
8)>tail. I eventually fell to their blows and received a birds
8)eye view of my
8)>corpse while I loaded to my home point. Rather than being in the
8)>courtyard,
8)>as I was when I died, my corpse was in a cavernous very
8)basement like area.
8)>Seems as I was floating serenely around unrest I was really floating
8)>noisily
8)>down in the basement and disturbing the peace of some very
8)nasty creatures
8)>that dwell therein. Three hours later, after delving fully
8)invis into the
8)>basement scouring it's entirety for my corpse, locating it
8)through a wall,
8)>and dealing with a very uncooperative guide (who said it was VERY
8)>retreivable and levitation worked just fine) it was summoned
8)to me, and I
8)>went about my merry way. The point of this story is to ask
8)at any attempts
8)>at an explanation as to why this happened, and how I can safely use
8)>levitation. It really is a blast as I thought it would be,
8)but who knows
8)>what mischeif and trouble I could get myself into in other
8)multi level
8)>dungeons. So, sorry for rambling, but has anyone else
8)experienced this,
8)>and
8)>does anyone want to venture an explanation?
8)>
8)>Ka`Lend
8)>
